<body>
<div class="csl-bib-body" style="line-height: 1.35; ">
  <div class="csl-entry" style="clear: left; margin-bottom: 1em;">
    <div class="csl-left-margin" style="float: left; padding-right: 0.5em;text-align: right; width: 1em;">1.</div><div class="csl-right-inline" style="margin: 0 .4em 0 1.5em;">Berthold, P. (1991). Genetic control of migratory behaviour in birds. Trends in Ecology and Evolution <i>6</i>, 254–257. <a href="https://doi.org/10.1016/0169-5347(91)90072-6">10.1016/0169-5347(91)90072-6</a>.</div>
  </div>
  <span class="Z3988" title="url_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fzotero.org%3A2&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1016%2F0169-5347(91)90072-6&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F21232472&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=Genetic%20control%20of%20migratory%20behaviour%20in%20birds&amp;rft.jtitle=Trends%20in%20Ecology%20and%20Evolution&amp;rft.volume=6&amp;rft.issue=8&amp;rft.aufirst=Peter&amp;rft.aulast=Berthold&amp;rft.au=Peter%20Berthold&amp;rft.date=1991&amp;rft.pages=254%E2%80%93257&amp;rft.spage=254&amp;rft.epage=257&amp;rft.issn=01695347"></span>
  <div class="csl-entry" style="clear: left; margin-bottom: 1em;">
    <div class="csl-left-margin" style="float: left; padding-right: 0.5em;text-align: right; width: 1em;">2.</div><div class="csl-right-inline" style="margin: 0 .4em 0 1.5em;">Frankel, N.S., Erezyilmaz, D.F., McGregor, A.P., Wang, S., Payre, F., and Stern, D.L. (2011). Morphological evolution caused by many subtle-effect substitutions in regulatory DNA. Nature <i>474</i>, 598–603. <a href="https://doi.org/10.1038/nature10200">10.1038/nature10200</a>.</div>
  </div>
  <span class="Z3988" title="url_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fzotero.org%3A2&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1038%2Fnature10200&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F21720363&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=Morphological%20evolution%20caused%20by%20many%20subtle-effect%20substitutions%20in%20regulatory%20DNA&amp;rft.jtitle=Nature&amp;rft.volume=474&amp;rft.issue=7353&amp;rft.aufirst=Nicol%C3%A3%20S.&amp;rft.aulast=Frankel&amp;rft.au=Nicol%C3%A3%20S.%20Frankel&amp;rft.au=Deniz%20F.%20Erezyilmaz&amp;rft.au=Alistair%20P.%20McGregor&amp;rft.au=Shu%20Wang&amp;rft.au=Francois%20Payre&amp;rft.au=David%20L.%20Stern&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft.pages=598%E2%80%93603&amp;rft.spage=598&amp;rft.epage=603&amp;rft.issn=00280836"></span>
  <div class="csl-entry" style="clear: left; ">
    <div class="csl-left-margin" style="float: left; padding-right: 0.5em;text-align: right; width: 1em;">3.</div><div class="csl-right-inline" style="margin: 0 .4em 0 1.5em;">Osterwalder, M., Barozzi, I., Tissiéres, V., Fukuda-Yuzawa, Y., Mannion, B.J., Afzal, S.Y., Lee, E.A., Zhu, Y., Plajzer-Frick, I., Pickle, C.S., et al. (2018). Enhancer redundancy provides phenotypic robustness in mammalian development. Nature <i>554</i>, 239–243. <a href="https://doi.org/10.1038/nature25461">10.1038/nature25461</a>.</div>
